intro: People either don’t have nails or they have too long of nails so they couldn’t open pop tabs and so I made a portable one that you can put on your keychain.
intro_items: People either don’t have nails or they have too long of nails so they couldn’t open pop tabs and so I made a portable one that you can put on your keychain.

etapes.html:
1. Step 1: Problem Statement

Étapes :

  1. People either don’t have nails or they have too long of nails so they couldn’t open pop tabs and so I made a portable one that you can put on your keychain

2. Step 2: Research

Étapes :

  1. SpongeBob-themed bottle openers, while not specifically designed for pop tabs, are popular collectible items that combine nostalgic appeal with practical use. Often made from metal and featuring fun designs, they serve as functional tools and conversation starters for fans of the show.

3. Step 3: Calculation/Data

Étapes :

  1. I had to figure out how big a pop tab is. I had to figure out what material and how infill to use.
  2. I traced this image on inventor then extruded it to how I liked it.

4. Step 4: Conclusion

Étapes :

  1. Conclusion: I think I did pretty good on this project because at the end I was able to fix everything that needed to be fixed

5. Step 5: Dimension

Étapes :

  1. Scale it 140% on Slicer I Used a Bambu Lab P1s
  2. Opening for the tab I added is 1 inch by .25 inch
